intro: Tristagma lomarum, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has small, dark green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a deep root system to access water from deeper soil layers. Tristagma lomarum plays an important role in supporting local wildlife, including insects and birds.
